summary: The document is an FBI identification form related to the JFK assassination, dated 04/24/98, with references to earlier communications from 1962. It includes details about the record's origin, classification, and status, as well as a teletype message regarding John Roselli's whereabouts. The document is part of the FBI's records on the JFK assassination, marked as unclassified and released with deletions. It has undergone review, with the last review date noted as 04/20/98, and is marked for indefinite retention.
key_findings: The document is part of the FBI's records on the JFK assassination, marked as unclassified and released with deletions.
A teletype message from SAC, Los Angeles to the Director of the FBI on 11/16/62 reports that John Roselli was not at his Los Angeles apartment or usual hangouts on that date.
The document has undergone review, with the last review date noted as 04/20/98, and is marked for indefinite retention.
